name: GOOGLE_TRENDS__GET_INTEREST_OVER_TIME
description: Fetches the interest for a list of keywords over a specified time period. The interest is on a scale of 0 to 100.

keywords.description: A list of up to 5 keywords to compare (e.g., ['Python', 'JavaScript']).

timeframe.description: The time period to analyze. Defaults to 'today 3-m'. Examples: 'now 7-d', '2023-01-01 2023-12-31'.

geo.description: The geographical region as a two-letter country code (e.g., 'US', 'PK'). Defaults to worldwide.

name: GOOGLE_TRENDS__GET_TRENDING_SEARCHES
description: Fetches the top daily trending search queries for a specific country.

country_code.description: The two-letter country code (e.g., 'US', 'GB', 'PK'). Defaults to 'US'.

max_results.description: The maximum number of trending searches to return. Defaults to 10.

name: GOOGLE_TRENDS__GET_RELATED_QUERIES
description: Finds 'top' and 'rising' search queries related to a given keyword.

keyword.description: The keyword to find related queries for (e.g., 'artificial intelligence').

max_results.description: The maximum number of results to return for both 'top' and 'rising' categories. Defaults to 10.

name: GOOGLE_TRENDS__GET_INTEREST_BY_REGION
description: Compares search interest for keywords by geographical region.

keywords.description: A list of keywords to compare.

timeframe.description: The time period to analyze. Defaults to 'today 3-m'.

resolution.description: The level of regional detail. Can be 'COUNTRY', 'REGION', 'CITY', or 'DMA'. Defaults to 'COUNTRY'.

max_results.description: The maximum number of regions to return. Defaults to 20.
